data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: I am turned into a sort of machine for observing facts and grinding out conclusions.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: A moral being is one who is capable of reflecting on his past actions and their motives - of approving of some and disapproving of others.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: On the ordinary view of each species having been independently created, we gain no scientific explanation.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: I have called this principle, by which each slight variation, if useful, is preserved, by the term of Natural Selection.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: We must, however, acknowledge, as it seems to me, that man with all his noble qualities... still bears in his bodily frame the indelible stamp of his lowly origin.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: I cannot persuade myself that a beneficent and omnipotent God would have designedly created parasitic wasps with the express intention of their feeding within the living bodies of Caterpillars.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: My mind seems to have become a kind of machine for grinding general laws out of large collections of facts.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, and not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: The mystery of the beginning of all things is insoluble by us; and I for one must be content to remain an agnostic.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: Man is descended from a hairy, tailed quadruped, probably arboreal in its habits.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: What a book a devil's chaplain might write on the clumsy, wasteful, blundering, low, and horribly cruel work of nature!

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: I have tried lately to read Shakespeare, and found it so intolerably dull that it nauseated me.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: The highest possible stage in moral culture is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: Man tends to increase at a greater rate than his means of subsistence.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: Animals, whom we have made our slaves, we do not like to consider our equal.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: False facts are highly injurious to the progress of science, for they often endure long; but false views, if supported by some evidence, do little harm, for every one takes a salutary pleasure in proving their falseness.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: An American monkey, after getting drunk on brandy, would never touch it again, and thus is much wiser than most men.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: We can allow satellites, planets, suns, universe, nay whole systems of universes, to be governed by laws, but the smallest insect, we wish to be created at once by special act.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: How paramount the future is to the present when one is surrounded by children.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: It is a cursed evil to any man to become as absorbed in any subject as I am in mine.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.en: At some future period, not very distant as measured by centuries, the civilized races of man will almost certainly exterminate, and replace the savage races throughout the world.
